SUBMISSION (40 CFR 68.150)

Visteon Corporation leases a automotive parts manufacturing facility in Chesterfield Township, Michigan, which is subject to the requirements of the Chemical Accident Prevention provisions of 40 CFR Part 68.

The following Risk Management Plan (RMP) was prepared in accordance with 40 CFR Part 68, using guidance obtained from the United States Environmental Protection Agency and the judgment of environmental professionals.  

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY (40 CFR 68.155)

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES (40 CFR 68.155 (a))  The Chesterfield Trim Plant stores TDI on-site in quantities in excess of 10,000 pounds.  The Chesterfield Trim Plant Environmental Management System (ISO 14001) program,

1.    Implementing work practices that minimize releases during the delivery and storage of TDI,
2.    Implementing inspection and corrective action procedures established under the Chesterfield Trim Plant Environmental Management System (ISO 14001) program,
3.    Employee training
4.    Limiting access to the TDI storage area, and 
5.    Planning and the training for response to an emergency

THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED (40 CFR 68.155(b))  The Chesterfield Trim Plant is automotive parts manufacturing facility producing a variety of products for Ford Motor Company.

The storage and dispensing of TDI at the Chesterfield Trim Plant is limited to one 8,800-gallons liquid TDI storage tank and its associated system.  The storage capacity of the tank is limited by administrative controls to 85 percent by volume or 7,480 gallons (75,000 pounds).  The TDI is used in the manufacturing of foam product

s.

WORST-CASE AND ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIOS (40 CFR 68.155 (C)) 
The release mechanisms were evaluated to define the worst-case scenario.  The mechanism selected as the worst case release is the release of the entire contents of the tank within its diked area inside the building.  The mechanism was selected to produce the worst case scenario since it produces the greatest distance to the highest concentration, however, none of the mechanisms evaluated produced concentrations of TDI that reached the toxic point at any location within or beyond the Chesterfield Trim Plant property line.  Therefore, the Chesterfield Trim Plant is a Program 1 facility.  The Chesterfield Trim Plant minimizes the possibility of any releases through the procedures, training, inspections established under its ISO 14001 Environmental Management System.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM (40 CFR 68.155(d)) 
The Chesterfield Trim Plant has developed and uses routine maintenance and operational controls to prevent accidents.  

The established worked practices for the delivery and storage of TDI at the Chesterfield Trim Plant outline the methods of transferring TDI form the delivery vessel to the storing TDI that minimizes releases.  

Each employee with job responsibilities associated with the storage, handling or use of TDI is thoroughly trained or otherwise deemed competent in the TDI-related work practices and procedures relevant to their responsibilities.

The inspection and corrective action procedures at the Chesterfield Trim Plant will be utilized to ensure that the structural integrity of the TDI system and the adequacy of the security measures associated with the systems are properly maintained.  

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY (40 CFR 68.155(e))
The Chesterfield Trim Plant has never had a reportable accidental release of TDI.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM (40 CFR 68.155(f))  
The Chesterfield Trim Plant has personnel trained to respond to the on-site effects of accidental
TDI releases.  If off-site response is necessary, the Chesterfield Trim Plant coordinates with the Chesterfield Fire Department and other emergency response agencies.
